node.title: Northland storm expected to cause flooding, possible tornadoes
node.description: Northland motorists are being warned to take care on the roads today, with heavy rain and thunderstorms forecast and the possibility of tornadoes.

node.title: Chinese official calls sanctions on Russia increasingly 'outrageous'
node.description: A senior Chinese government official says sanctions imposed by Western nations on Russia over Ukraine are increasingly "outrageous".

node.title: Blood found at Auckland address, but no one present
node.description: Police are appealing for witnesses after blood was found at an East Tamaki address this morning.

node.title: Siren love: Noisy neighbourhood nuisance or misunderstood musical subculture?
node.description: To some they provoke nothing but contempt, but those who compete in Auckland's siren battles say it's a 'brotherhood' giving Pacific youth a positive alternative to night clubbing and gangs. Video

node.title: Ukraine: 'Tanks in streets' as fighting hits Mariupol centre
node.description: Efforts to rescue hundreds of people trapped in the basement of a bombed theatre in the besieged city of Mariupol are being hampered by intense battles in the area, the mayor says.

node.title: Council's colourful shot at encouraging girls to use basketball court nets criticism
node.description: A spruced-up basketball court in Christchurch has been caught up in a flurry of Facebook comments claiming it played into gender stereotypes.

node.title: 'He avoids risks' - The secret life of Vladimir Putin
node.description: When it comes to his personal affairs, Vladimir Putin is a closed book, with details surrounding his family and relationships remaining a closely guarded subject.

node.title: Transport investigators recommend harnesses be compulsory for hot air balloon pilots
node.description: Harnesses should be mandatory for hot air balloon pilots during take-off and landing to stop them being flung from baskets, transport investigators say.

node.title: Former Kentucky clerk Kim Davis violated rights of same-sex couples, judge says
node.description: Former clerk Kim Davis refused to issue marriage licenses to two same-sex couples in 2015.

node.title: UNICEF says 1.5 million kids fleeing Ukraine at risk of trafficking, exploitation
node.description: Following Russia's attacks, more than 3 million people have fled Ukraine, including 1.5 million children.

node.title: Beamish into final, Hobbs misses out
node.description: Runner Geordie Beamish has eased through to the final of the men's 3000m at the World Athletics Indoor Championships in Belgrade, Serbia.

node.title: China reports first Covid-19 deaths in more than a year
node.description: Mainland China reported its first Covid-19 deaths in more than a year on Saturday, according to a post on the National Health Commission's website that said two people died in the northeastern region…

node.title: Green MP Chlöe Swarbrick tests positive for Covid-19
node.description: Green Party MP and Auckland Central representative Chlöe Swarbrick has tested positive for Covid-19, joining a long line of MPs who have tested positive during the Omicron surge.

node.title: What does it mean to be 'neutral' over Ukraine - and what responsibilities come with it?
node.description: Studying past wars helps us understand what aspects of a current crisis might be worth asking critical questions about, Maartje Abbenhuis writes.

node.title: John Clayton, longtime NFL journalist, has died at 67
node.description: Clayton spent five decades covering the NFL.

node.title: Hospitals and doctors all over Europe work to get young patients out of Ukraine
node.description: Some of the millions who have fled Ukraine are dealing not only with the trauma of war but also with serious health conditions like cancer.

node.title: Women make up just 24% of the cyber workforce. CISA wants to fix that.
node.description: CISA Director Jen Easterly tells CBS News her "unreasonable goal" of getting women to make up 50% of the cyber workforce is achievable.

node.title: All Whites debutant scores in win over PNG
node.description: The All Whites are edging closer to qualifying for the 2022 Fifa World Cup with victory over Papua New Guinea in Qatar.

node.title: Drought-stricken California imposes new round of water cuts
node.description: Water agencies that serve 27 million people and 750,000 acres of farmland will get just 5% of what they've requested this year.

node.title: Cargo ship could be stuck in Chesapeake Bay for over a week, officials say
node.description: The Ever Forward is a massive cargo ship that ran aground 24 feet deep into mud Sunday night.

node.title: Russians push deeper into port city of Mariupol as locals plead for help
node.description: The fall of Mariupol, the scene of some of the war's worst suffering, would mark a major battlefield advance for the Russians

node.title: Prince William and Kate embark on tour to Central America and Caribbean
node.description: The trip suffered a hitch before the couple set out, when a planned visit to a cacao farm in Belize was scrapped because of local opposition.

node.title: China reports its first coronavirus-related deaths in over a year
node.description: The deaths come sharp contrasts emerge in the global battle with the virus.

node.title: Zelenskyy pushes for talks with Putin as Russia intensifies attacks
node.description: The United Nations estimates 6.5 million people have been displaced by the war.

node.title: Longest-serving US congressman dies
node.description: US Republican Representative Don Young, who had served in Congress since 1973, has died, his office said in a statement on Friday.

node.title: William and Kate cancel cacao farm visit after protests from locals
node.description: Prince William and his wife Kate will not visit a cacao farm in an indigenous region of Belize after local villagers staged a protest against their arrival.

node.title: 'Chance for a re-set': Expert pushes for sustainable tourism
node.description: International visitors could soon be pouring across the border in similar numbers to pre-pandemic times - but that might not be a good thing, according to one tourism expert.

node.title: High demand for digital skills, supply is lagging
node.description: The tech sector is wasting no time taking advantage of a government plan to support training aimed at expanding the pools of skilled tech workers.

node.title: Man shot by police near Invercargill
node.description: A man is undergoing surgery in hospital after he was shot by police on State Highway 1 at Dacre, north of Invercargill.

node.title: Ukraine: How crowdsourcing is rescuing people from the war zone
node.description: One challenge facing those looking to escape is to find a route that is not under heavy bombardment from Russian forces.
